 ∙ Full cervical dilatation (10 cm; the cervix is no longer felt on vaginal examination), a bulging thin 
perineum, a gaping vagina and anus, and the head visible through the introitus, even in between 
contractions indicate the second stage of labour, and that delivery is imminent. (see annexure – 
describe vaginal examination procedure in detail)
